body.name: Baby Trend Trooper 3-in-1 Convertible Car Seat, Quartz Pink
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 23. Order within 9 hrs 51 mins
features: 3 Modes of Use: Rear Facing Infant mode (4-18lbs), Rear Facing Toddler mode (18-40lbs), and Forward Facing Toddler mode (22-65lbs)
Immediate Right Installation Angle: Rear-facing recline flip foot allows for great installation angles with ease; the built-in bubble level indicator helps find the correct angle
Now includes two integrated cupholders for convenience for your little one!
Fits Three Across: At its widest, the Trooper is 16.75" allowing it to fit 3 across in most vehicle
Lightweight: Lightweight shell also allows for use of LATCH installation up to 55 lbs
body.description: The Baby Trend Trooper 3-in-1 Convertible Car Seat converts from rear facing infant seat (4-18lbs) and rear facing toddler seat(18-40lbs), to forward facing toddler seat (22-65lbs) as your child grows. With 5-position shoulder height adjustment and 3- position crotch buckle for seat adjustment, the Trooper convertible gives parents the ultra convenience for installation and adjustment. The rear-facing recline flip foot also allows the Trooper to get great installation angles with ease. Trooper's nimble frame can fit three across in most vehicles which is great for families that have more than one kiddo. The lightweight shell also allows for use of LATCH installation up to 55 lbs. The super deep side wings offer better side impact protection and premium cushion, giving your babies great head protection and support. With premium fabric and two convenient integrated cup holders, our Baby Trend Trooper 3-in-1 Convertible Car Seat truly gives your children the most comfortable and convenient commute/travel experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nicely looking, well made, easy to use
reviews.reviewText: Affordable and well made! I had to buy 2 to put in our second car as we have 2 toddlers. Easy to install and use. Cup holder present and kiddos seem comfortable. Great value and Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewText: Sturdy and comfortable car seat for my girl. It’s not too big and not too small. Lightweight but doesn’t seem or feel cheap.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very easy to set up in vehicle, very spacious for my baby we love it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Installation is the biggest downfall of an otherwise great seat!
reviews.reviewText: Pros: This carseat is AMAZINGLY slim while not trading out any of the comfort. The cup holder is spacious yet sturdy and allows for even wider based sippy cups to fit. My little one loves this seat. The color is absolutely gorgeous, however, it is more of a lilac than a pink.Cons: installation is a bit extreme. It does not work well with small SUV seats, the Nissan Kicks angled back seats don't allow for it to sit well without a towel or noodle in the crack for toddler's to rear face. It took almost an hour of trying various things and adjustments to get the seat to sit correctly both level and stable. The flip foot is stupid, it is either sitting straight up for front facing or it's laying WAY down for newborn rear facing. The seat has the level indicators for infant and toddler rear facing, but the foot doesn't really allow you to use them. It could not be done without using something to prop the seat up level, which is frustrating. But, in the end we used a noodle and were able to get the proper install angle and the stability a carseat should have.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars The price is right...that's about it.
reviews.reviewText: I mean, it's okay I guess. I like the color. The seat is very basic, but you get what you pay for. I needed to fit a booster seat, infant seat, and carseat in the back of a Honda CRV. The carseat had to be as narrow as possible and all the other comparable options were well out of my price range. For $89, this was definitely budget friendly, especially considering that the infant would eventually grow out of the infant seat and I would need to have two carseats that were narrow enough to fit in the back seat with a booster. This seat is around 17 inches wide, which fit the bill perfectly.Being at the price-point that it is, it doesn't really come with any bells and whistles. You need to manually re-thread the harness as the baby grows, which is a pain if you don't want to take the seat out of your car to do so. It wasn't awful to install, but we also had a CPST certified installer at a local fire station help us out with it.My biggest problem with it is that it seems one strap is ALWAYS longer than the other and at times I worry that I can't pull both straps tight enough because of this. The straps are also constantly getting twisted as well. When we were still getting used to the seat, my then one year old baby was able to wiggle her arms out on a couple of occasions. I love seeing her happy, smiling face...but not when it's looking at me in my rearview mirror! So you really have to be careful with these straps and ensuring that they're actually tight enough, which, as I stated before, is difficult because one seems longer than the other. We manage to make it work, but it takes a lot of fiddling to make them even and it's just so much more of a headache than it needs to be.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is perfect for anyone. It goes from new born to toddler.
